Class TextUtil

java.lang.Object

    • transform

      public static <T extends CharSequence> void transform(T template, Function<? super String,? extends T> env, Consumer<? super CharSequence> output)
      Transform a templated Text.

      Read template and copy its contents to output. For each reference in the form ${VARIABLE}, the substitution is determined by calling env.apply("VARIABLE").

      Type Parameters:
      T - the generic type to use
      Parameters:
      template - the template
      env - substitution environment
      output - output

      public static boolean contentEquals(CharSequence a, CharSequence b)
      Compare two character sequences for content equality.

      Returns:
      true, if a and b contain the same characters

    • lexicographicComparator

      public static Comparator<@Nullable String> lexicographicComparator(Locale locale)
      Creates a lexicographic comparator for strings based on the specified locale. The comparator first uses locale-specific rules for comparison and then falls back to natural string order if the locale-specific comparison deems the strings equivalent. Null values are considered less than non-null values.

      Note: The returned Comparator is not threadsafe.

      Parameters:
      locale - the locale to be used for sorting strings. It determines the locale-specific rules used by the comparator.
      Returns:
      a comparator that compares strings lexicographically based on the specified locale.

    • asCharSequence

      public static CharSequence asCharSequence(char[] chars)
      Converts a character array into a CharSequence.
      Parameters:
      chars - the character array to be converted into a CharSequence
      Returns:
      a CharSequence wrapping the provided character array

    • lines

      public static String[] lines(CharSequence s)
      Splits the provided character sequence into an array of lines, using the predefined line splitting pattern.

      For a parameter s of type string, this unit returns the same result as s.split("\\R")}.

      Parameters:
      s - the character sequence to be split into lines
      Returns:
      an array of strings, where each string represents a line extracted from the input character sequence

      public static String normalizeLineEnds(String s)
      Convert all line ends to '\n'.
      Parameters:
      s - the input string
      Returns:
      input string with normalized line ends

    • toUnixLineEnds

      public static String toUnixLineEnds(String s)
      Convert all line ends to Unix convention.
      Parameters:
      s - the input string
      Returns:
      input string with Unix line ends

      Convert all line ends to Windows convention.
      Parameters:
      s - the input string
      Returns:
      input string with Windows line ends

      Convert all line ends to system convention.
      Parameters:
      s - the input string
      Returns:
      input string with system line ends

    • setLineEnds

      public static String setLineEnds(String s, String lineEnd)
      Adjusts the line endings of a given string by replacing the current line terminators with the specified line end sequence. If the input string is newline-terminated, the specified line end sequence will also terminate the result.
      Parameters:
      s - the input string whose line endings are to be modified
      lineEnd - the desired line ending sequence to apply
      Returns:
      a string with the adjusted line endings

    • quote

      public static String quote(String text)
      Surrounds a string with quotes and escapes control characters according to Java conventions.
      Parameters:
      text - the string to be surrounded with quotes
      Returns:
      the quoted string

    • quoteIfNeeded

      public static String quoteIfNeeded(String text)
      Returns a quoted string if needed, otherwise returns the original string.
      Parameters:
      text - the string to be checked if quoting is needed
      Returns:
      the quoted string if needed, otherwise the original string

    • joinQuotedIfNeeded

      public static String joinQuotedIfNeeded(List<?> args, String delimiter)
      Joins the elements of the given list into a single string, using the specified delimiter. If an element needs to be quoted, it will be enclosed in quotes before joining.
      Parameters:
      args - the list of elements to be joined
      delimiter - the delimiter to be used between the elements
      Returns:
      the joined string with each element quoted if necessary

    • joinQuotedIfNeeded

      public static String joinQuotedIfNeeded(List<?> args)
      Joins the elements of the given list into a single string, using ', ' as delimiter. If an element needs to be quoted, it will be enclosed in quotes before joining.
      Parameters:
      args - the list of elements to be joined
      Returns:
      the joined string with each element quoted if necessary

    • joinQuoted

      public static String joinQuoted(List<?> args, String delimiter)
      Joins the elements in the given list into a single string, quoting each element. Null elements are treated in the same way as empty strings.
      Parameters:
      args - The list of elements to be joined, can contain elements of any type.
      delimiter - the delimiter to insert between args
      Returns:
      A single string that is the result of joining all the elements, with each element quoted and separated by a comma and space.

    • joinQuoted

      public static String joinQuoted(List<?> args)
      Joins the elements in the given list into a single string, quoting each element and using ', ' as delimiter. Null elements are treated in the same way as empty strings.
      Parameters:
      args - The list of elements to be joined, can contain elements of any type.
      Returns:
      A single string that is the result of joining all the elements, with each element quoted and separated by a comma and space.

    • isBlank

      public static boolean isBlank(CharSequence cs)
      Checks if a CharSequence is empty or consists of whitespace characters only.
      Parameters:
      cs - the CharSequence to check
      Returns:
      true if the CharSequence is blank, false otherwise

    • isNullOrBlank

      public static boolean isNullOrBlank(@Nullable CharSequence s)
      Checks if the provided CharSequence is either null or blank (consists only of whitespace characters).
      Parameters:
      s - the CharSequence to be checked, may be null
      Returns:
      true if the CharSequence is null or blank, otherwise false

    • wrap

      public static String wrap(String s, int width, Alignment align, boolean hardWrap)
      Wraps a given string `s` into multiple lines based on the specified `width`, alignment, and hard wrap options.

      This method uses the "\n" as line separator.

      Parameters:
      s - the input string to be wrapped
      width - the maximum width of each line
      align - the alignment of the text within each line
      hardWrap - a boolean value indicating whether to break words when wrapping
      Returns:
      a new string with the wrapped lines

    • wrap

      public static String wrap(String s, int width, Alignment align, boolean hardWrap, String lineSeparator)
      Wraps a given string `s` into multiple lines based on the specified `width`, alignment, and hard wrap options.
      Parameters:
      s - the input string to be wrapped
      width - the maximum width of each line
      align - the alignment of the text within each line
      hardWrap - a boolean value indicating whether to break words when wrapping
      lineSeparator - the line separator to use
      Returns:
      a new string with the wrapped lines

    • toString

      public static String toString(@Nullable Object obj, String valueIfNull)
      Returns a string representation of the specified object. If the provided object is not null, return obj.toString(). If the provided object is null, return the specified value instead.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to convert to string representation. Can be null.
      valueIfNull - The string value to return if the object is null.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the specified object, or the specified value if the object is null.

    • toCharArray

      public static char[] toCharArray(CharSequence text)
      Converts a CharSequence into a char[] array. If the input is a String, its toCharArray() method is used directly. Otherwise, the characters are extracted manually.

      Security Note: This method avoids calling toString() on non-String inputs, preventing potential string interning of sensitive data. This allows complete cleanup of sensitive character data from memory.

      Parameters:
      text - the CharSequence to be converted to a char[] array
      Returns:
      a char[] array representation of the input CharSequence

      Returns:
      the byte array

    • normalize

      public static String normalize(CharSequence s)
      Normalizes the given character sequence by applying Unicode normalization in NFKC form and normalizing line endings.
      Parameters:
      s - the character sequence to be normalized
      Returns:
      a normalized string with Unicode NFKC form and standardized line endings ('\n')

    • normalizeEmail

      public static String normalizeEmail(CharSequence email)
      Normalizes an email address by performing the following transformations: 1. Unescapes any HTML entities in the email string. 2. Converts the email to lowercase using the default locale. 3. Trims any leading and trailing whitespace.

      The method also does basic validation of the email to ensure that: - The normalized email is not empty. - The email does not contain newline characters. - The email contains a single '@' symbol, which is neither at the beginning nor at the end.

      Parameters:
      email - the original email address to be normalized; must be a valid string
      Returns:
      the normalized email address as a lowercase and stripped string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the email fails validation as described above

    • splitOnUnescapedDelimiter

      public static String[] splitOnUnescapedDelimiter(CharSequence s, char delimiter)
      Splits the input string into an array of substrings using the specified delimiter, while ignoring instances of the delimiter that are escaped with a backslash.
      Parameters:
      s - the input character sequence to be split
      delimiter - the character used as the delimiter for splitting the string
      Returns:
      an array of substrings obtained by splitting the input string on the specified delimiter, excluding delimiters that are escaped with a backslash

    • createUnescapedDelimiterPattern

      public static Pattern createUnescapedDelimiterPattern(char delimiter)
      Creates a regex pattern string that matches an unescaped occurrence of the specified delimiter. An unescaped delimiter is identified by ensuring it is not preceded by a backslash.
      Parameters:
      delimiter - the character for which an unescaped occurrence pattern is to be created
      Returns:
      a string representing the regex pattern for matching the unescaped delimiter
